? NC_NR_SENS_KNK is used to de?ne the number of knock sensor used (from 1 to 4)
? NC_NR_N_32_i_KNCK are used to de?ne the number of breakpoints for LDPM_N_32_i_KNCK axis (i from 1
to 5). Do not use null value for these data.
? NC_NR_MAF_H_RNG_j_KNCK are used to de?ne the number of breakpoints for LDPM_MAF_H_RNG_j_
KNCK axis (j from 1 to 2). Do not use null value for these data
? NC_NR_GEAR_1_KNCK is used to de?ne the number of breakpoints for LDPM_GEAR_1_KNCK axis.Do not
use null value for these data
? NC_KNKS_CYL_CONF_x are used to de?ne the association between cylinder and knock sensor. NC_
KNKS_CYL_CONF is written on 16 Bits. For each cylinder number corresponds 2 bits.
The cylinder number corresponds to the software cylinder number.

NC_NR_GEAR_1_KNCK is used to de?ne the number of breakpoints for LDPM_GEAR_1_KNCK axis.Do not
use null value for these data
? NC_KNKS_CYL_CONF_x are used to de?ne the association between cylinder and knock sensor. NC_
KNKS_CYL_CONF is written on 16 Bits. For each cylinder number corresponds 2 bits.
The cylinder number corresponds to the software cylinder number. For each cylinder, the 2 bits give the knock
sensor number from 0 to 3

? NLC_KNKS_SW is a switch to choose between Knock by Software (1) or Knock IC (0) version
? NC_NR_MAF_H_RNG_IGA_AD_1_KNK and NC_NR_N_32_IGA_AD_1_KNK_LEN are used to de?ne the number
of areas used to memorize AD 1 corrections. These NC are de?ning size of IGA_AD_1_KNK_SAVE and ID_
IGA_AD_1_KNK_LEN. Default value are 6 and 8.
For small engines (4 cylinders, natural aspirated), typical values are 4 (for NC_NR_MAF_H_RNG_IGA_AD_1_KNK)
and 6 (for NC_NR_N_32_IGA_AD_1_KNK_LEN) to have 24 areas for each cylinder.
For medium engines (4 cylinders turbo, 6 cylinders), typical values are 6 and 8 to have 48 areas for each
cylinders.
? NC_NR_OPP_IGA_AD_1_KNK is the number of working points of AD 1 maps. It must be de?ned as NC_NR_
MAF_H_RNG_IGA_AD_1_KNK x NC_NR_N_32_IGA_AD_1_KNK_LEN
? NC_NR_WIN_KNK must be set to 1 to use only 1 knock window (the main window), and to 2 to use 2
knock windows (pre-window and main window).
? NC_T_OFF_WIN_KNK is the minimum dead-time mandatory between pre and main window. .
? NLC_KNKS_FRQ_H is a switch to choose between low (75kHz, NLC_KNKS_FRQ_H = 0) and hi (100kHz,
NLC_KNKS_FRQ_H = 1) frequency
? NC_FAC_KNKS_QLY_FIL is the quality factor of the ?lter that is typically 2.3
? NC_NR_KNKS_MAX_SAMPLE is the maximum number of samples treated. This value has to be choosen
taking the available RAM memory into account, acquisition frequency, acquisition window length and
min engine speed:
NC_NR_KNKS_MAX_SAMPLE = (max window duration / (6 * min engine speed ))
* sampling frequency
? NC_NR_PRE_KNKS_MAX_SAMPLE is the maximum number of samples acquired during the pre-window
This value has to be choosen taking the available RAM memory into account, acquisition frequency,
acquisition window length and min engine speed:
NC_NR_PRE_KNKS_MAX_SAMPLE = (max window duration / (6 * min engine speed ))
* sampling frequency
? NLC_KNKS_WIN_PIN_SW has to be set to 1 to get knock pre and main window signal available.

NC_NR_PRE_KNKS_MAX_SAMPLE is the maximum number of samples acquired during the pre-window
This value has to be choosen taking the available RAM memory into account, acquisition frequency,
acquisition window length and min engine speed:
NC_NR_PRE_KNKS_MAX_SAMPLE = (max window duration / (6 * min engine speed ))
* sampling frequency
? NLC_KNKS_WIN_PIN_SW has to be set to 1 to get knock pre and main window signal available. If this NLC
is at 0, no hardware window information can be used for calibration.
? NLC_KNKS_ENA_APP is a switch to choose between IO driver init (act/deact) is in generic core (no
change) (0) or in application-incidence (1).

? NC_NR_MAX_FRQ is a switch to choose how many frequencies are required for knock signal KNKS de-
termination.
? NC_FID_KNK_LIH_ENA - De?ned by FARM to enable knock limp home operation
? NC_FID_KNK_AD_1_ENA - De?ned by FARM to enable adaptation circuit 1 activation
? NC_FID_KNK_RTD_LIM - De?ned by FARM to enable knock retard limitation
? NC_FID_KNK_WIN_RTD_LIM[NC_CYL_NR] - De?ned by FARM to enable cylinder individual knock retard
limitation
? NC_FID_ERR_ACQ_KNK - De?ned by FARM for inhibition of knock acquisition chain diagnostic
? NC_FID_ERR_BAS_KNK - De?ned by FARM for inhibition of knock sensor basic diagnostic
? NC_FID_ERR_REL_KNK - De?ned by FARM for inhibition of knock sensor relative diagnostic
? NC_FID_DIAG_KNK_EOL - De?ned by FARM for activation of knock sensors end of line diagnostic
? NLC_USE_PI_ER_HB - Engine roughness mode for Preignition con?rmation (based on ER low range = 0,
based on ER high range = 1)
? NC_NR_MAX_FIL_FRQ_KNK and NC_NR_MAX_FIL_FRQ_KNK de?nes number of datasets for band pass
?lter calibration, and for gain and threshold maps.

� General Information
53.2.1 Knock Signal Acquisition
� General Information
This function is adapted for ?oating point ?ltering in the FPU of the micro-processor.
The sampling frequency has to be checked by the IO KNK responsible.
If 2 knock windows are used (NC_NR_WIN_KNK = 2), the treatment shown below is done twice for each cylinder
calculation, to generate KNKS_PRE and KNKS.
The multifrequency calculation can only be performed in the main knock window. With NC_NR_MAX_FRQ up
to 3 central frequencies can be chosen and each ?lter width tuneable.
By the switch LC_KNKS_FIL_TAB, different ?lter tables can be chosen, affecting both ?lters (0 =>up to 20kHz ,
1 =>up to 25.9kHz).

53.2.2 Knock Window Settings Calculation
� General Information
It must be guaranteed that the con?guration of the knock pre and main windows is transferred in time for
the given cylinder when calling this action in order to well acquire the knock window . And so the actions
SetKnkBySoftWinPre and SetKnkBySoftWin are called one segment before the acquisition. KNKWD given to
IO has as minimum 0.375�CRK.

53.2.3 Filter and Integrator Calculation
� General Information
The calculation of the parameters is executed at ?rst.
The execution of the following calculations has to be concluded before the next window beginning. This is
checked by ACTION_INFR_GetKnkBySoftDiag and ACTION_INFR_GetKnkBySoftDiagPre (in 2 windows mode)
In 2 windows mode (NC_NR_WIN_KNK = 2), KNKS_PRE calculation must be ?nished before the next pre-window,
and KNKS calculation must be ?nished before the next main window.
The variables V_KNKS, KNKS_INT_INP and KNKS_INT_OUT are used as internal intermediate calculation vari-
ables.
The output datas KNKS_PRE and KNKS must be formatted to a 16Bit (or FFFF) value to ?t the requirements of
the knock control strategy.
� Application Conditions

STATE_KNK_SW_ACQ_ERR = 0
Activation: LV_ES = 0
Deactivation: LV_ES = 1
Recurrence: at knock main window end

KNCK, Acquisition of combustion noise
KNKS_PRE calculation:
This section is executed only if NC_NR_WIN_KNK = 2
Calculation of ?ltering and integration coef?cients :
KNKS_PHY_GAIN = NC_KNKS_PHY_GAIN[KNKS_CMD_GAIN_PRE[CYL_KNK]]
KNKS_PHY_INT = NC_KNKS_PHY_INT[KNKS_CMD_INT_PRE[CYL_KNK]]
KNKS_FIL_FAC_1[0] = NC_KNKS_FIL_FAC_1[KNKS_CMD_FIL_PRE[CYL_KNK]]
KNKS_FIL_FAC_2[0] = NC_KNKS_FIL_FAC_2[KNKS_CMD_FIL_PRE[CYL_KNK]] / NC_FAC_KNKS_QLY_FIL
a0[0] = 1 + KNKS_FIL_FAC_2[0]
Note: The variables above do not explicitly have to be calculated and are only mentioned to facilitate the
reading of the following calculations. In software, they should not appear if possible. Their values are read in
the maps under.
?Filter coef?cients:
FAC_KNK_FIL_1[0] = KNKS_FIL_FAC_1[0] / a0[0]
FAC_KNK_FIL_2[0] = (KNKS_FIL_FAC_2[0] - 1) / a0[0]
FAC_KNK_GAIN[0] =(KNKS_FIL_FAC_2[0] * KNKS_PHY_GAIN) / a0[0]
? Integrator coef?cient:
FAC_KNK_INT = KNKS_PHY_INT
/*get the number of samples for the pre-window and number of treated cylinder*/
ACTION_INFR_GetKnkSoftBufInfPre(KNKS_SAMPLE_NR, CYL_KNK)
/*Get address of the 1st sample of Pre-window acquisition buffer*/
ACTION_INFR_GetVKnksPreBySoft(V_KNKS_PRE)
/* Initializations */
KNKS_FIL_INP?1 = KNKS_FIL_INP ?2 = ?oating pointformatting [2.5V * KNK_SW_FMT]
KNKS_INT?1[0] = ?oating point formatting [0V * KNK_SW_FMT]
KNKS_FIL_OUT?1[0] = KNKS_FIL_OUT?2[0] = ?oating pointformatting [0V * KNK_SW_FMT]
/* Filtering and integration loop */
if KNKS_SAMPLE_NR <2
then KNKS_PRE[CYL_KNK]= FFFFformatting [0V]
else
for k =( 0 ; KNKS_SAMPLE_NR ? 1 ; k++)
/* get sample k */
? Filtering
KNKS_FIL_INPk = ?oating pointformatting [V_KNKS_PREk]
KNKS_TMPk = (KNKS_FIL_INPk - KNKS_FIL_INPk?2)
KNKS_FIL_OUTk[0] = KNKS_TMPk + KNKS_FIL_OUTk?1[0] * FAC_KNK_FIL_1[0]
+ KNKS_FIL_OUTk?2[0] * FAC_KNK_FIL_2[0]
? Integration
KNKS_INT_INPk[0] = | KNKS_FIL_OUTk[0] |
KNKS_INTk[0] = KNKS_INT_INP k[0] + KNKS_INTk?1[0]
endfor

/*last computation for Integration */
KNKS_INT_OUT =(KNKS_INTKNKS _SAMPLE _NR?1[0] + KNKS_INTKNKS _SAMPLE _NR?2[0])
/* output data de?nition and formatting */
KNKS_PRE[CYL_KNK] = FFFFformatting [FAC_KNK_GAIN[0] * FAC_KNK_INT *
KNKS_INT_OUT/KNK_SW_FMT]

� General Information
In case the throttle position gradient or the intake manifold pressure gradient exceeds adjustable limits ( load
dynamics ), an ignition angle intervention shall be performed in order to avoid knocking combustion.
After detection of load dynamics, the ignition intervention is not activated, before a calibratable number of
segments have passed. During this delay the determined ignition adjustment (dependent on engine operating
point, fuel quality, vehicle speed and gear) is updated towards stronger interventions. Depending on the value
of LC_SCHA_TRA_KNK the ignition adjustment will be or not executed during this delay. At the end of the delay
time - after the last update - the ignition intervention will be executed unchanged for a calibratable number of
cycles.
After the end of this constant intervention phase, the ignition adjustment is reset to zero with calibratable
increment steps.
Generally the ignition angle intervention is activated when the engine is in part-load condition. This can be
overruled by calibration to activate even in idle speed condition if idle speed controller requests high load in
order to prevent engine speed drop.
The ignition angle intervention of load dynamics is terminated whenever the drive train is detected open or
when engine speed is below a minimum threshold. But, by calibration, the function can be kept active even if
drive train is disengaged because knock can occur if driver makes tip-in? without any gear.
Since the trigger conditions (throttle- and pressure gradient) for ignition angle adjustment are linked by an
"OR" operator, it might occur that both conditions are satis?ed after a short time, thus causing a reiterated,
undesired ignition angle intervention. To prevent this effect an adjustable waiting time before the next trigger
of load dynamics can be applied.
2 application incidence data (LV_IGA_TRA_KNK_APP and LV_INH_IGA_TRA_KNK_APP) can also be used to de?ne
project speci?c activation or inhibition conditions.
The ignition angle correction calculated in this generic core can be adapted with the 2 factors IGA_TRA_KNK_
GAIN_APP and IGA_TRA_KNK_OFS_APP, generated in application-incidence.
� Application Conditions

KNCK, Instationary correction (knock prevention)
53.4.1.2.1 Delay state
Ignition angle correction is calculated in the delay state.
Correction is calculated depending on engine working point (speed and load). Corrective factors are applied
depending on Gearbox ratio, vehicule speed, intake air temperature and fuel quality.
Additionnal correction can be calculated in project speci?c application incidence speci?cation by using the 2
factors IGA_TRA_KNK_GAIN_APP and IGA_TRA_KNK_OFS_APP.
If LC_SCHA_TRA_KNK = 0 the correction is applied in this delay state

53.6.1.2 Normal operating mode:
Detection of NL jumps caused by ?lter frequency change.
When the ?lter frequency is changing, this can cause sudden increase of KNKS, and false detection (as NL is
slowest than KNKS).
To avoid this, when a change in ?lter frequency is detected, a fast NL ?ltering coef?cient is applied for C_CTR_
DLY_FIL_GAIN_APP cycle (typical calibration 1 to 5).
Calculated only if LC_KNK_APP_TEST= 0
When multiple injection is activated, different calibration sets are used for gain and frequency.
Calibration sets are selected in function of value of IDX_FIL_FRQ_KNK and IDX_FIL_GAIN_KNK based on value
of IDX_CMB_MOD_CUR
When calibration set is changed, special ?ltering constant is applied for NL calculation, in order to avoid wrong
detection. Also load dynamic is activated. This is activated during C_CTR_DLY_FIL_GAIN_KNK_INI segments.
This can be inhibited by setting C_CTR_DLY_FIL_GAIN_KNK_INI equaled to 0.

� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at reset or Engine running to engine stop
LAMB_SP_KNK[0..NC_CBK_EX_NR-1] = C_LAMB_SP_KNK_PAS

Recurrence: 100ms
� Function Description
If BIT 0 of CLF_CONF_LAMB_SP_KNK = 1
Then IGA_MV_KNK_LAMB_SP_KNK = IGA_MV_KNK_ADD
Else IGA_MV_KNK_LAMB_SP_KNK = IGA_MV_KNK
Endif
IGA_MV_KNK_THD_LAMB_SP_KNK = IP_IGA_MV_KNK_THD_LAMB_SP_KNK [N, MAF_FG_CYL_IGN_
1]
If IGA_MV_KNK_LAMB_SP_KNK < IGA_MV_KNK_THD_LAMB_SP_KNK
Then LAMB_SP_KNK_BAS = IP_LAMB_SP_KNK_BAS [N, IGA_MV_KNK_LAMB_SP_KNK]
LAMB_SP_KNK_tmp = IP_LAMB_SP_KNK [TIA, LAMB_SP_KNK_BAS]
Else LAMB_SP_KNK_tmp = C_LAMB_SP_KNK_PAS
Endif
For i=0 to NC_CBK_EX_NR-1
If LAMB_SP_KNK_tmp - LAMB_SP_KNK[i] >= C_DIF_LAMB_SP_KNK_INC
Then LAMB_SP_KNK[i] = LAMB_SP_KNK[i] + C_DIF_LAMB_SP_KNK_INC
Else
If LAMB_SP_KNK[i] - LAMB_SP_KNK_tmp >= C_DIF_LAMB_SP_KNK_DEC
Then
LAMB_SP_KNK[i] = LAMB_SP_KNK[i] - C_DIF_LAMB_SP_KNK_DEC
Else
LAMB_SP_KNK[i] = LAMB_SP_KNK_tmp
Endif
Endif
EndFor

speed conditions, above MAF_HB threshold, TCO threshold, on stable conditions and no detection have oc-
curred for C_CTR_NL_AD_KNK TDC.
Moreover, the knock adaptive may be inhibited on project speci?c conditions de?ned through the ?ag LV_INH_
NL_AD_KNK.
For aggregate scalability, the input gain adaptation functionnality can be removed by setting NLC_NL_AD_
KNK_INH to 1.

The adaption circuit 1 is enabled above a MAF_HB threshold (depending on engine speed), on steady con-
ditions (no speed nor load dynamic detected), if knock control is activated, and if error ?ags, which have an
impact on the functions, are not raised.
All of these conditions must be ful?lled during C_CTR_AD_1_KNK cycles to activate AD 1 loop.
Moreover, the knock adaptive may be inhibited on project speci?c conditions de?ned through the ?ag LV_INH_
KNK_AD_1.

� General Information
The global circuit adaptation is enabled if
* the AD1 loop is activated
* and MAF is higher than a dedicated threshold
* and TCO is higher than a dedicated threshold.
Moreover, the knock adaptive may be deactivated on project speci?c conditions de?ned through the ?ag
LV_INH_FAC_AD_KNK (de?ned in application incidence).
For aggregate scalability, the global adaptation (RON AD) functionnality can be removed by setting NLC_FAC_
AD_KNK_INH to 1.

Figure 53.7.15:
53.7.4 Knock control activation
� General Information
The knock control function is activated if the start phase is ?nished, if the engine is running in homogeneous
mode and if key is on. In addition, the MAF_HB value must be above a calibrable threshold depending on
engine speed.
Knock control is deactivated on the cylinders in limp-home with the ?ag LV_KNK_LIH_ENA.
The knock control function may be inhibited on project speci?c conditions de?ned through the ?ag LV_INH_
KNK_CTL.
In case of deactivation of the knock control, the passive mode is activated where the spark retard is driven
back to 0�CRK through calibrable increment.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST, Deactivation
Activation: LV_ES == 0
Deactivation: LV_ES == 1
Recurrence: SEG

53.7.6 Limp home activation
� General Information
The knock limp home mode is activated on several conditions: in case of knock sensor failure or crankshaft
failure, or when engine synchronisation is not guaranteed (except during engine start phase). Moreover, the
limp home mode may be activated on project speci?c conditions de?ned through the ?ag LV_INH_KNK_LIH.
It must be noted that the LV_KNK_LIH_ENA is cylinder-dependant, and that the LV_KNK_LIH ?ag is set to 1 as
soon as there is 1 cylinder in limp-home.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST, Deactivation
Activation: LV_ES == 0
Deactivation: LV_ES == 1
Recurrence: SEG

Threshold to enable the gain adaptation (typical value 0.2V)
� General Information
Knock sensors signals are used to calculate engine noise level NL.
This noise value is then used to compute the knock thresholds KNKS_THD.
Finally, the knock energy is evaluated and knock event is detected if the energy is larger than a threshold.
In addition to this, parameters for knock sensors acquisition chain are calculated

KNCK, Knock detection
The knock detection is performed for cylinder-individually de?ned measurement windows since knock-typical
oscillations only occur for certain crankshaft angles. The measurement windows (crank angle of beginning
and duration) are speci?ed as function of the engine speed and load.
For the main knock window, the crank angle for the beginning of the measurement window is taken for each
cylinder from the respective table IP_KNKWB[NC_CYL_NR] according to the ?ring order. The beginning is
de?ned in relation to the respective TDC.
The crank angle for duration of the measurement window is taken for each cylinder from the respective table
IP_KNKWD[NC_CYL_NR] according to the ?ring order.
For the pre-window, the crank angle for the beginning of the measurement window is taken for each cylin-
der from the respective table IP_KNKWB_PRE_H_RNG[NC_CYL_NR]. The beginning is de?ned in relation to the
respective TDC.
The crank angle for duration of the measurement window is taken for each cylinder from the respective table
IP_KNKWD_PRE[NC_CYL_NR] according to the ?ring order.
An overlap protection is avoiding main window starting before pre-window is closed. In case of overlap, priority
is given to main window, and the pre-window is reduced.

KNCK, Knock detection
53.8.1.2.1.1 Knock pre and main windows overlap protection
For each cylinder, knock pre-window must be closed before begining of the main window, and a minimum
time NC_T_OFF_WIN_KNK must be respected.
There are 3 cases:
1: the pre-window is closed before the main window, including the min off time. In this case, the pre-window
begin and duration are applied as calibrated,
2: the pre-window end does not respect the off time, but the duration can be reduced. In this case, the pre-
window begin is applied as calibrated, and duration is reduced to respect the off time,
3: the pre-window end does not respect the off time, and the duration cannot be reduced. In this case, a default
pre-window is applied: duration is set to min (0.375 �CRK), begin is set accordingly.
An indication ?ag LV_KNK_WIN_OVLP is set if the pre-window is not applied as calibrated (cases 2 and 3).

53.8.2 Engine noise calculation
� General Information
When knock is not detected, NL[NC_CYL_NR] is the result of a ?rst order low pass ?ltering of the sensor signal.
Thus NL[NC_CYL_NR] is a moving mean average of KNKS.
The ?lter coef?cient depending on the engine conditions can be changed.
When knock is detected, the NL[NC_CYL_NR] calculation is frozen for a calibrable number of TDC.
NL is limited to the minimum value C_NL_MIN

If no knock event is detected for C_CYCNR_KNK_DET cycles, normal NL calculation is done (NL_calculation_

53.8.3 Threshold calculation
� General Information
The knock threshold KNKS_THD[SEG_NR] is used to calculate the knock energy KNKS_ EGY, which is then used
for knock decision.
The knock threshold is calculated for each cylinder separately and depends on the cylinder individual noise
value.
KNKS_THD = NL * IP_KNKS_THD_FAC + IP_KNKS_THD_ADD
In case of engine speed or load dynamic, the KNKS_THD is multiplied by a factor C_FAC_TRA_KNK (this is used
to clip the threshold to max value during transient phase in order to avoid false knock detection).
KNKS_THD is initialised to 5V at reset or at engine stop, and is limited to C_KNKS_THD_MAX..
2 calibration sets can be used for threshold factor, depending on IDX_FIL_GAIN_KNK (input generated in
application-incidence):
IP_KNKS_THD_FAC when IDX_FIL_GAIN_KNK is 0
IP_KNKS_THD_FAC_1 when IDX_FIL_GAIN_KNK is 1.

53.8.4 Knock energy calculation
� General Information
An energy of the knock intensity is calculated by dividing instantaneous engine noise (KNKS) by knock thresh-
old (KNKS_THD, calculated using NL). This energy gives a representation of the knock intensity for the current
cylinder.
If KNKS_EGY is greater than the threshold C_EGY_KNKS_THD, a knock event is detected.
A multiplication factor (generated in application-incidence) FAC_EGY_KNK_APP is used to modify knock energy
calculation for project-speci?c functionalities. It can also be used to inhibit knock detection by setting KNKS_
EGY to 0.
LV_KNK is initialised to 0

53.8.5 Input gain adaptation
� General Information
The knock adaptive gain function allows adapting the gain programmed in the knock IC device for each
cylinder. It is designed to compensate knock sensor dispersion, engine dispersion and engine ageing.
For each cylinder, the noise level NL is monitored, the gain of input stage is changed to keep the knock signal
at the de?ned level.
Adaptive value are stored in NVMY during power-latch phase, and read back at ECU reset. They can be reset
to 0 before being stored by setting LC_KNK_AD_CLR to 1.
Update rate: for each cylinder at each C_NL_AD_CTR TDC

53.8.5.2 Formula section of KNKS_CMD_GAIN_AD
2 parts:
1-Calculation of deviation from NL to the target for each cylinder (NL_DIF_CLC bloc)
2-Increase or decrease gain while keeping it in the boundaries (GAIN_AD_CLC bloc)
53.8.5.2.1 Adaptive value calculation
Target for NL is given by IP_NL_GAIN_AD.
If NL-IP_GAIN_AD >NC_NL_AD_THD
NL is higher than the target, gain must be incremented to reduce physical gain
Else If NL-IP_GAIN_AD <-NC_NL_AD_THD
NL is lower than the target, gain must be decremented to increase physical gain
If NL is close to the target, gain is not modi?ed.

53.8.6 Knock sensor acquisition chain calibration
� General Information
An IC device is used to format the raw output signal coming from the knock sensor. A band pass ?ltering
is performed by the knock IC device followed by integration during the knock window. The output value of
the integrator after the end of the measurement window is fed as Knock Value KNKS[x] through an analog
channel to the control algorithm.
Parameters to be provided to this IC are
* Selection of input channel (KNKS_CMD_CONF)
* Gain of input buffer (KNKS_CMD_GAIN and KNKS_CMD_GAIN_PRE) integrating adaptive part of gain for the
main window only
* Frequency of band pass ?lter (KNKS_CMD_FIL and KNKS_CMD_FIL_PRE )
* Integration time constant (KNKS_CMD_INT and KNKS_CMD_INT_PRE.

53.8.6.2 Formula section
2 calibration sets can be used for gain and ITC, depending on IDX_FIL_GAIN_KNK (input generated in application-
incidence):
IP_KNKS_GAIN / IP_ITC_KNK when IDX_FIL_GAIN_KNK is 0
IP_KNKS_GAIN_1 / IP_ITC_KNK_1 when IDX_FIL_GAIN_KNK is 1.
NC_NR_MAX_FIL_FRQ_KNK calibration sets can be used for BP ?lter calibration depending on IDX_FIL_FRQ_
KNK (input generated in application incidence): ID_KNKS_FAC_FIL / ID_KNKS_FIL_FRQ / ID_KNKS_FIL_QLY
53.8.6.2.1 Knock detection - three ?lter solution
The Array Dimensions of all IDs are extended by NC_NR_MAX_FRQ. This value can range from one to three for
this three ?lter solution.

� General Information
The knock control function is done is several steps presented in the following overview.
If the knock control is active, the ?rst step is to check if the adaptive values have reached the maximum retard
adjustment. If it is the case, the knock control will be limited. In the other case, the normal knock control
operation is performed followed by the control excursion limit and the limitation of the total ignition retard.
If the knock control is not active the knock control goes to a passive mode. In this mode the spark retard is
reset to 0 through calibratable increment.
If LV_KNK_CTL_ACT_ENA = 1
- Knock control active
- Calculation of Maximum Retard Adjustment (IGA_CYL_KNK_MAX)
- Calculation of Total Sum of Adaptation Circuit 1 and Global adaptation (IGA_SUM_AD_KNK[x])
If IGA_SUM_AD_KNK[x] >IGA_CYL_KNK_MAX
then
- Normal operation
- Control excursion limit
- Limitation of total ignition retard
else
- Limitation of Knock control
endif
else
- Knock control passive (Reset after abandoning the knock-Operating Limit)
endif

53.9.4 Instantaneous correction
� General Information
If a knock event is detected, an instantaneous spark retard correction corresponding to this knock event is
calculated.
Depending on the engine speed and MAF_HB engine operating point, a corresponding spark retard IGA_DEC_
KNK is calculated. This spark retard depends also on the energy level of the knock event
IGA_DEC_KNK is initialised to 0.

53.9.5 Fast loop correction
� General Information
The fast loop correction allows cumulating ignition angle correction until knock disappears. Then it comes
back the spark retard to 0�CRK .
Ramp-up is done with calibratible increments (calibration of increment angle and step duration)
The vector IGA_CYL_KNK_FAST is initialised to 0.

53.9.6 Control excursion limit
� General Information
The control excursion limit is used to limit the difference of the fast loop correction of the current cylinders to
a certain value around the mean value of all cylinders. All 720 �CRK the arithmetic mean value of the cylinder
ignition adjustment angles IGA_KNK_BAS_COR[x] is calculated:
All 720/Cyl. �CRK a test will be done, to see whether the ignition adjustment angle of the just calculated cylinder
is more retarded or advanced than
|IGA_MV_KNK-C_IGA_ DIF_MIN_MAX_KNK|. In this case the knock control fast angle is limited to the control
excursion limit.

KNCK, Knock control
This knock control state is executed when the adaptative values have already reached the maximal spark
retard value allowed. In this case the normal knock control is not executed and the spark retard is limited to
IGA_CYL_KNK_MAX.

53.9.10 Final correction applied
� General Information
The ?nal correction is calculated in this part.
A function called cylinder-leading function allows in case of knock detection problems on certain cylinder to
associate the deaf cylinder to a leading cylinder. This function must be used only in case of big knock detection
problems.
If N_32 is above the threshold C_N_IGA_KNK_THD_1(2) and if the leading cylinder C_IGA_KNK_MST_CYL has
a later spark retard than the slave cylinder C_IGA_KNK_SLA_CYL_1(2) then the slave cylinder get the latest
retard.
In addition, a limitation is done on the correction angle in respect ot the average correction of all cylinders.
The vectors IGA_CYL_KNK and IGA_CYL_KNK_AV are initialised to 0.
� Application Conditions

Activation: LV_ES==0
Deactivation: LV_ES==1

53.9.10.2.3 Calculation of ignition angle correction
The ignition angle correction (IGA_CYL_KNK_AV) is choosen between limp home value, passive value (ramp-
up to 0 when knock control is disabled), limited value (IGA_CYL_KNK_LIM) or nominal value (IGA_CYL_KNK_
NOM).
When entering limp home, a ramp-down is made to reach the limp home correction angle (with C_IGA_DEC_
LIH)
When leaving the limp home, a ramp-up with C_IGA_INC_LIH is done to cancel correction

53.9.10.2.4 Final control excursion limit
In this bloc the correction for the current cylinder is limited around the mean value of all corrections (IGA_MV_
KNK_ADD) . C_IGA_DIF_MIN_MAX_KNK de?nes the band around the mean value.
If the cylinder is limited, then the AD 1 correction is frozen (activation of LV_KNK_INH_AD_1_RTD). AD1 is released
when the correction for the current cylinder is entering an area around the mean value, de?ned as C_IGA_DIF_
MIN_MAX_KNK/2

53.9.11 Adaptation circuit 1
� General Information
Adaptation circuit 1 is a slow cylinder individual correction based on fast loop.
For each cylinder x, the correction is stored in a table IGA_AD_1_KNK_SAVE[x, IDX_IGA_AD_1_KNK_SAVE].
The working point IDX_IGA_AD_1_KNK_SAVE is calculated using ID_IGA_AD_1_KNK_LEN.
When the engine WP is changing, the ?rst action is to apply the previously saved correction, and then to start
AD 1 correction.
During the power latch, all corrections saved in the adaptation maps IGA_AD_1_KNK_SAVE are stored in the
non-volatile memory and read back at the next KEY ON.
Before storing the values, a global increment C_IGA_AD_1_INC_KNK is added to each point of adaptation maps.
With this function it is possible to reduce large adapted values without ful?lling the adaptation conditions.
The adaptation tables may be initiated in new condition or through maintenance service with 0 �CRK
Number of adaptation area can be adapted for each application with NC parameters de?ned in knock con?g-
uration speci?cation.

Figure 53.9.44:
53.9.11.2.3.1.2 Adaptation in retard direction
Decrementation of ignition angle to correct knock.
First calculate the correction (calculation_of_adapt)
Then apply correction if IGA_KNK_BAS is lower than C_IGA_AD_1_THD_DEC + IP_IGA_DEC_KNK,
If IGA_KNK_BAS between C_IGA_AD_1_THD_INC and C_IGA_AD_1_THD_DEC + IP_IGA_DEC_KNK, or if LV_KNK_
INH_AD_1_RTD is active (e.g. if the fast correction is limited by control excursion limit) then no adaptation is
done (no change on correction)

53.9.13 Global adaptation circuit (RON adjustment)
� General Information
Because of a bad fuel, the AD 1 corrections are larger than usual.
When the mean AD 1 correction is larger than a threshold, an adaptive factor FAC_AD_KNK is incremented, and
a correction IGA_AD_KNK is calculated and applied to all cylinders.
If the mean AD 1 correction is becoming smaller than a second threshold, the global adaptive factor is decre-
mented and the ignition angle correction is progressively cancelled.
A global adaptive factor at 0 means the fuel quality is good, at 1 means the fuel quality is very bad.
As it can appends that in some working points the engine is not knocking, the global AD factor must be kept
unchanged for these WP to avoid ramping down to 0. This is done by comparing the IP_IGA_BAS_DIF_AD_KNK
calibration to a threshold C_IGA_BAS_DIF_AD_KNK_ENA. If the calibration is higher than the threshold, then the
global adaptive factor is frozen.
A special limitation during a driving cycle is possible. If the adaptation conditions are active for a certain time
after an engine start, the FAC_AD_KNK is considered as correct (e.g. representative of the fuel quality). After
this time, FAC_AD_KNK change is allowed only as a percentage of the ?correct? value.
During the power latch phase, the adaptive factor is stored in the non volatile memory and read back at the
next key on.
Before storing the value, the global AD factor can be modi?ed depending on TCO, or can be reset to 0 if
LC_KNK_AD_CLR is active
A special bench mode activated by LC_FAC_AD_KNK_MAN_ACT allows manual setting of FAC_AD_KNK

53.9.13.2 Formula section in case of nvmydata
If the non volatile memory is on failure or blank, the global AD factor is reset to 0.
During power latch phase, FAC_AD_KNK can be modi?ed
* by C_FAC_AD_KNK_COLD if TCO is lower than C_TCO_FAC_AD_KNK_MIN,

* initialized at 0 if LC_KNK_AD_CLR is active,
or left unchanged before storing in NVMY

Figure 53.9.67:
53.9.13.3 Time-synchronous (100 ms) formula section
Each 100 ms, and if the LV_CTR_FAC_AD_KNK_LIM ?ag is active (e.g. if the conditions for counting down are
met), the CTR_FAC_AD_KNK_LIM counter is decremented.
If the counter is at 0, the LV_FAC_AD_KNK_LIM ?ag is set to 1 to activate FAC_AD_KNK limitation, and the limits
on FAC_AD_KNK are frozen.
Note: as soon as this ?ag is set, it is never reset to 0 during the driving cycle

Figure 53.9.68:
53.9.13.4 Segment-synchronous formula section
Global adaptation loop is done is 4 steps:
1-Calculation of the increment and the decrement to be applied to FAC_AD_KNK (CLC_SEG bloc)
2-Apply (or not) the increment or decrement depending on AD 1 mean correction (CLC_FAC_AD_KNK bloc)
3-Limit FAC_AD_KNK (FIN_CLC bloc)
4-Calculation of global correction on ignition angle IGA_AD_KNK(CLC_IGA_AD_KNK bloc)
FAC_AD_KNK value can be increased by offset value FAC_AD_KNK_OFS_REQ in case of trig by LV_FAC_AD_
KNK_OFS_REQ (bad fuel detection).

Figure 53.9.70:
53.9.13.4.3 Counter start
Counter for increment is started when the AD 1 mean correction is lower than C_IGA_MAX_AD.
Counter for decrement is started when the AD 1 mean correction is higher than C_IGA_MIN_AD.
If only a small correction is needed for the current working point (IP_IGA_BAS_DIF_AD_KNK >C_IGA_BAS_DIF_
AD_KNK_ENA), then the 2 counters are stopped to avoid unexpected decrement of FAC_AD_KNK
The ?ag LV_CTR_FAC_AD_KNK_LIM is used to activate CTR_FAC_AD_KNK_LIM (counter for driving cycle excur-
sion limitation) decrement. It is set when inc or dec counters are active, and if if the needed correction for the
working point is higher than C_IGA_BAS_DIF_AD_KNK_LIM.

� General Information
When a failure is detected on the knock sensor, a limp home mode is activated.
A spark retard depending on engine speed and air-mass is then applied, corrected by a factor depending on
TCO.
Correction calculation can be modi?ed with IGA_CYL_KNK_LIH_GAIN_APP and IGA_CYL_KNK_LIH_OFS_APP,
data generated in application-incidence.
Note: the limp-home correction angle is always calculated, but applied only when the limp home ?ag is set.

Activation: LV_ES==0
Deactivation: LV_ES==1

� General Information
53.12.1 Pre-Ignition Detection Function
� General Information
In order to detect self-ignition f.e. due to hot?spots in the combustion chamber, two main criteria have to be
checked. First a threshold detects knock in order to obtain the ?rst glow ignition criteria for the cylinder (X).
The second one is set by a mis?re-based detection for the cylinder (X-1). After those conditions, the cylinder is
shut-off for the entire driving cycle. The maximum number of cylinders that can be shut-off is 2 for a 6-cylinder
engine.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST, IGKON, ES2ERU, Engine stop (LV_ES = 1)
LV_PI_DET_ACT = 0
LV_PI_ER_DET_ENA = 0
Activation: after 2 engine cycles
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: Segment
// This function is called after calculation MISF aggr and KNKS
signal
� Function Description
A new threshold for the precondition is calculated in order to obtain well adapted
detection. If the knock-signal exceeds this threshold, a counter will be triggered
after a adjustable delay and the misfire-check-window is active (the second criteria
for the pre-ignition).
During the first precondition window is active, the engine roughness is compared
with a new engine roughness pre-ignition threshold. After an applicable number
of misfire (engine roughness at cylinder X-1 due to pre-ignition), the cylinder
X will be shut-off.
Because of the Misfire calculation method, an ignition advance due to pre-ignition
in cylinder X will apply a breaking force on cylinder X-1.
IF LV_ES = 0
AND TCO > C_TCO_MIN_PI
AND C_N_32_MIN_PI < N_32 < C_N_32_MAX_PI
AND [ ( (C_LOAD_MIS_MIN_PI < LOAD_MIS ? C_LOAD_MIS_MAX_PI )
AND LC_MAF_HB_ENA_CDN_PI = 0 )
OR ( (MAF_HB > IP_MAF_HB_PI[N_32] ) AND LC_MAF_HB_ENA_CDN_PI = 1 )

]
AND [LV_KNK_CTL_ACT_ENA = 1 OR LC_KNK_CTL_ENA_COND_DI = 1]
AND [ ( LV_N_TRA_KNK = 0 AND LV_MAF_TRA_KNK = 0 )
OR LC_TRA_KNK_DEAC_PI = 1 ]
THEN
LV_PI_DET_ACT = 1 after delay of C_DLY_PI_DET_ACT segments
ELSE
LV_PI_DET_ACT = 0
ENDIF
The below assignment is done only when LV_PI_DET_ACT is equal to 1.
LV_INH_PI_ER_DET [CYL_ID_KNK - C_SEG_NR_DLY_INH_DET_MIS] = LV_INH_DET_MIS
IF LV_PI_DET_ACT = 1
AND {LV_ENA_ER = 1 OR LC_ER_ENA_COND_DI = 1]
AND LV_INH_PI_ER_DET [CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
AND LC_PI_CDN_MIS = 1
THEN
LV_PI_ER_DET_ENA = 1
ELSE
LV_PI_ER_DET_ENA = 0
ENDIF

53.12.2.1 Pre window slow PI detection
// For detection of pre-ignition, last recurrence value of NL_PRE[CYL_ID_KNK]
is temporary used
FAC_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = IP_FAC_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK]
THD_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = NL_PRE[CYL_ID_KNK]n-1 x
FAC_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK]
// The threshold is limited to IP_THD_KNK_PRE_PI_MAX
IF THD_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] > IP_THD_KNK_PRE_PI_MAX
THEN THD_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = IP_THD_KNK_PRE_PI_MAX
ENDIF
// Detection of pre-ignition symptom in pre-window
IF KNKS_PRE_RNG_H[CYL_ID_KNK] ? THD_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK]
THEN LV_DET_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
CTR_KNK_PRE_PI_CYL_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = ID_CTR_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW (N_32)
ELSE LV_DET_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
ENDIF
// Start counter for detection window
IF CTR_KNK_PRE_PI_CYL_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] > 0
AND LV_DET_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
THEN
CTR_KNK_PRE_PI_CYL_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] =
CTR_KNK_PRE_PI_CYL_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] - 1
ENDIF
// Pre-ignition confirmed counter
IF(1) CTR_KNK_PRE_PI_CYL_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] > 0
THEN(1)
IF(2) LV_DET_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1

53.12.4.1 Main window slow PI detection
// Threshold calculation
FAC_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = IP_FAC_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK]
THD_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = KNKS_THD [CYL_ID_KNK] x FAC_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_
KNK]
// The threshold is limited to IP_THD_KNK_PI_MAX
IF THD_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] > IP_THD_KNK_PI_MAX
THEN THD_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = IP_THD_KNK_PI_MAX
ENDIF
// Detection of pre-ignition symptom for main window
IF KNKS_RNG_H[CYL_ID_KNK] ? THD_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK]
THEN LV_DET_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
CTR_KNK_PI_CYL_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = ID_CTR_KNK_PI_SLOW (N_32)
ELSE LV_DET_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
ENDIF
// Start counter for detection window
IF CTR_KNK_PI_CYL_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] > 0
AND LV_DET_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
THEN CTR_KNK_PI_CYL_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = CTR_KNK_PI_CYL_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] - 1
ENDIF
// Pre-ignition confirmed counter
IF(1) CTR_KNK_PI_CYL_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] > 0
THEN(1)
IF(2) LV_DET_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
THEN(2) CTR_KNK_PI_DET_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] =
CTR_KNK_PI_DET_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] + 1
ENDIF(2)
IF(3) CTR_KNK_PI_DET_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] ? ID_THD_KNK_PI_SLOW (N_32)
THEN(3) LV_DET_CFM_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
ENDIF(3)
ELSE(1)
CTR_KNK_PI_DET_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
LV_DET_CFM_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
ENDIF(1)

53.12.4.3 PI detection based on pre and main window sum
// Counter for pre and main window
// PI events detected in pre and main window are summed up in a same counter
CTR_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI_DET[CYL_ID_KNK] = CTR_KNK_PI_DET_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] +
CTR_KNK_PRE_PI_DET_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK]
LV_DET_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = LV_DET_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] OR
LV_DET_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK]
// Max selection of cylinder selective "glow-ignition" event counters
CTR_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI_DET_MAX = MAX{CTR_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI_DET[x], for x = 0 to (NC_
CYL_NR-1)}
LV_DET_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI_MAX = MAX{LV_DET_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI[x], for x = 0 to (NC_
CYL_NR-1)}
// in case of events in both windows, counter is reduced
IF CTR_KNK_PI_DET_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] > 0
AND CTR_KNK_PRE_PI_DET_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] > 0
AND CTR_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI_DET[CYL_ID_KNK] > ID_THD_CFM_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI(N_32)
THEN LV_DET_CFM_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
ELSE LV_DET_CFM_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
ENDIF

� General Information
53.13.1 Cylinder Limp Home and Short Cylinder Shut Off
� General Information
Cylinder shut-off is limited by C_PI_MAX_NR_OFF_IV, a maximum number of cylinders can be shut-off simulta-
neously. The bit of the switched off cylinder is set to 1 in INH_IV_PI.
Carrier structure: INH_IV_PI
>Cylinder 0 , CYL_ID_KNK = 0
>Cylinder 1 , CYL_ID_KNK = 1
>Cylinder 2 , CYL_ID_KNK = 2
>Cylinder 3 , CYL_ID_KNK = 3
>Cylinder 4 , CYL_ID_KNK = 4
>Cylinder 5 , CYL_ID_KNK = 5
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at reset, Key on:
LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI[for all cylinders] = 0
CTR_DUR_INH_IV_PI[for all cylinders] = 0
INH_IV_PI = 0
CTR_IV_OFF_PI[for all cylinders] = 0
LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI_SLOW[for all cylinders] = 0
LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI_FAST[for all cylinders] = 0
CTR_DUR_SHUT_OFF_PI_DET[for all cylinders] = 0
LV_SHUT_OFF_PI_REQ[for all cylinders] = 0
LV_DLY_SHUT_OFF_PI(for all cylinders) = 0
CTR_DLY_SHUT_OFF_PI(for all cylinders) = 0
LV_DLY_CYL_SHUT_OFF_PI(for all cylinders) = 0
CTR_DLY_CYL_SHUT_OFF_PI(for all cylinders) = 0
Activation: LC_ENA_PI_OFF_IV = 1
Deactivation: LC_ENA_PI_OFF_IV = 0
Recurrence: Segment
// This function is called after calculation MISF aggr and KNKS
signal
� Function Description

KNCK, Reactions to pre ignition detection
Duration of system reaction shut off should be calibratable over engine speed
(8 breakpoints - IP_CTR_DUR_SHUT_OFF_PI_DET)) and activated if CTR_KNK_PRE_MAIN_
PI_DET_MAX is greater than a calibratable number of cycles over engine speed
(8 breakpoints - ID_CTR_SHUT_OFF_PI_DET).
In case of cylinder shut off all other system reactions (lambda, cam in and torque)
should be cancelled , by reason of torque reduction limitation to a maximum of
25% (one cylinder is off) and catalyst protection.
// Short shut off request
// triggering of shut off request
IF LV_DLY_SHUT_OFF_PI[x]=0, for x = 0 to NC_CYL_NR
// lv_dly_shut_off_pi have to be checked for all cylinders in order to avoid
simultaneous temporary shut off
AND LV_DLY_CYL_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
// lv_dly_cyl_shut_off_pi has to be checked only for current cylinder
//same cylinder cannot be temporary shut off until delay is elapsed
AND LC_ENA_TMP_SHUT_OFF_PI = 1
AND CTR_NR_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] < C_CTR_NR_SHUT_OFF_PI_MAX
AND [
CTR_KNK_PRE_PI_DET_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] > ID_THD_SHUT_OFF_PRE_PI_DET(N_32)
OR CTR_KNK_PI_DET_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] > ID_THD_SHUT_OFF_PI_DET(N_32)
OR (
CTR_KNK_PI_DET_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] > 0
AND CTR_KNK_PRE_PI_DET_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] > 0
AND CTR_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI_DET[CYL_ID_KNK] > ID_THD_SHUT_OFF_PRE_
MAIN_PI_DET(N_32)
)
]
THEN
LV_SHUT_OFF_PI_REQ[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
ENDIF
// request activation transition is checked
// cylinder shut off
IF LV_SHUT_OFF_PI_REQ[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0 to 1
THEN
bit [CYL_ID_KNK] of INH_IV_PI = 1
// time delay between shut off events is initialized
CTR_DLY_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = IP_CTR_DLY_SHUT_OFF_PI (N_32)
CTR_DLY_CYL_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = IP_CTR_DLY_CYL_SHUT_OFF_PI (N_32)
ENDIF
// duration initialized when request is active
IF [ LV_SHUT_OFF_PI_REQ[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
AND CTR_DUR_SHUT_OFF_PI_DET[CYL_ID_KNK] < IP_CTR_DUR_SHUT_OFF_PI_DET(N_32)]
THEN
CTR_DUR_SHUT_OFF_PI_DET[CYL_ID_KNK] = CTR_DUR_SHUT_OFF_PI_DET[CYL_ID_KNK]
+ 1
ELSE
LV_SHUT_OFF_PI_REQ[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
ENDIF
// reactivation of cylinder
IF LV_SHUT_OFF_PI_REQ[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1 to 0
THEN
File: 15602S01.00G
22298Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without
expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
KNCK, Reactions to pre ignition detection
bit [CYL_ID_KNK] of INH_IV_PI = 0
CTR_DUR_SHUT_OFF_PI_DET[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
ENDIF
// time delay between shut off events
IF CTR_DLY_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] > 0
THEN
CTR_DLY_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = CTR_DLY_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] - 1
LV_DLY_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
ELSE
LV_DLY_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
ENDIF
IF CTR_DLY_CYL_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] > 0
THEN
CTR_DLY_CYL_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK]=CTR_DLY_CYL_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK]-1
LV_DLY_CYL_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
ELSE
LV_DLY_CYL_SHUT_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 0
ENDIF
Requests coordination:
IF LV_DET_CFM_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
OR LV_DET_CFM_KNK_PI_SLOW [CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
OR LV_DET_CFM_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW [CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
THEN
LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI_SLOW [CYL_ID_KNK]= LC_ENA_PI_OFF_IV_SLOW
ELSE
LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI_SLOW [CYL_ID_KNK]= 0
ENDIF
IF LV_DET_CFM_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
THEN
LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI_FAST [CYL_ID_KNK]= LC_ENA_PI_OFF_IV_FAST_1
ELSE
IF LV_DET_CFM_KNK_PI_FAST [CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
OR LV_DET_CFM_KNK_PRE_PI_FAST [CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
THEN
LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI_FAST [CYL_ID_KNK]= LC_ENA_PI_OFF_IV_FAST_2
ELSE
LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI_FAST [CYL_ID_KNK]= 0
ENDIF
ENDIF
LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK]= LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI_SLOW [CYL_ID_KNK] OR LV_REQ_IV_
OFF_PI_FAST [CYL_ID_KNK]
Shut Off management
IF SUM_INH_IV < C_PI_MAX_NR_OFF_IV
AND LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
THEN
bit [CYL_ID_KNK] of INH_IV_PI = 1
CTR_DUR_INH_IV_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = C_CTR_DUR_INH_IV_PI
ELSE
IF C_CTR_DUR_INH_IV_PI < 65535
// C_CTR_DUR_INH_IV_PI = 65535 corresponds to irreversible cylinder
cut-off
File: 15602S01.00G
22299Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without
expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
KNCK, Reactions to pre ignition detection
AND CTR_IV_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] <= C_CTR_IV_OFF_PI_MAX
THEN
IF CTR_DUR_INH_IV_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] > 0
THEN CTR_DUR_INH_IV_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = CTR_DUR_INH_IV_PI - 1
ELSE
IF (LV_PUC = 1 OR LV_PU = 1)
OR (PV_AV = 0 AND LC_PV_INH_IV_PI_CDN = 1)
THEN bit [CYL_ID_KNK] of INH_IV_PI = 0
ENDIF
ENDIF
ENDIF
ENDIF
Shut Off events counter
IF bit [CYL_ID_KNK] of INH_IV_PI =0 to 1
THEN
IF LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
THEN
CTR_IV_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = CTR_IV_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] + 1
ENDIF
ENDIF
53.13.2 Lambda Set-point Limp Home
� General Information
Enrichment setpoint correction is activated in case of PI detection in pre-window or in main window.
After de?ned number of PI events, lambda setpoint is enriched.
Value of Lambda setpoint is function of engine speed.
Duration of Lambda setpoint correction is function of engine speed.
After duration is elapsed, lambda setpoint ramp?up is applied.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at reset, key on, engine stop:
LAMB_SP_PI_DET = C_LAMB_SP_PI_DET_INI
CTR_DUR_LAMB_SP_PI_DET = 0
LV_LAMB_SP_PI_ACT = 0
LV_LAMB_SP_PI_REQ = 0
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: Segment
// This function is called after calculation MISF aggr and KNKS
signal
� Function Description

KNCK, Reactions to pre ignition detection
// Enrichment setpoint correction
// trigerring of lambda setpoint request
IF CTR_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI_DET_MAX > ID_CTR_LAMB_SP_PI_DET (N_32)
THEN
LV_LAMB_SP_PI_REQ = 1
ENDIF
// initialization of lambda setpoint
// request activation is checked
IF LV_LAMB_SP_PI_REQ = 1
THEN
LAMB_SP_PI_DET = IP_LAMB_SP_PI_DET(N_32, MAF_STK_FG_PRED)
ENDIF
// initialization of lambda setpoint request duration
// duration initialized when request is active, and at each new detected event
IF LV_LAMB_SP_PI_REQ = 1
AND LV_DET_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI_MAX = 1
THEN
CTR_DUR_LAMB_SP_PI_DET = IP_CTR_DUR_LAMB_SP_PI_DET(N_32)
ENDIF
// lambda setpoint ramp-up after duration is elapsed
IF CTR_DUR_LAMB_SP_PI_DET = 0
AND LAMB_SP_PI_DET < C_LAMB_SP_PI_DET_INI
THEN
LAMB_SP_PI_DET = LAMB_SP_PI_DET + C_LAMB_SP_PI_DET_INC
ELSE
IF CTR_DUR_LAMB_SP_PI_DET = 0
THEN
LAMB_SP_PI_DET = C_LAMB_SP_PI_DET_INI
ENDIF
ENDIF
// management of duration counter
IF CTR_DUR_LAMB_SP_PI_DET = 0
THEN
LV_LAMB_SP_PI_REQ = 0
ELSE
CTR_DUR_LAMB_SP_PI_DET = CTR_DUR_LAMB_SP_PI_DET - 1
ENDIF
// activation lambda setpoint request
IF LAMB_SP_PI_DET < C_LAMB_SP_PI_DET_INI
THEN
LV_LAMB_SP_PI_ACT = 1
ELSE
LV_LAMB_SP_PI_ACT = 0
ENDIF
// In case of cylinder shut off all other system reactions (lambda, cam in and
torque) should be cancelled, by reason of torque reduction limitation to a maximum
of 25% (one cylinder is off) and catalyst protection.
IF bit [CYL_ID_KNK] of INH_IV_PI = 0 to 1
THEN
LV_LAMB_SP_PI_REQ = 0
LAMB_SP_PI_DET = C_LAMB_SP_PI_DET_INI
CTR_DUR_LAMB_SP_PI_DET = 0
LV_LAMB_SP_PI_ACT = 0
ENDIF

<PRM_ABC>, OUT <PRM_STATE_FIL>)

ACTION_ERRM_Record(IN <PRM_IDX_ERR>, IN <PRM_STATE_FIL>)
ACTION_ERRM_Reset(IN <PRM_IDX_ERR>)
� General Information
The aim of this function is to make a general diagnosis of the complete knock sensor acquisition chain: knock
sensor and knock IC device.
3 tests are done to detect a failure:
1-absolute test on the basic value of the knock signal.
This test is a comparison between the knock sensor signal output and a threshold (see picture 1).
2-relative test between instantaneous value of basic knock signal and its mean value (test of scattering on the
acquisition signal)
Indeed, the knock sensor signal peak-to-peak value is lower in case of failure (knock sensor disconnected, short
circuit to ground or to battery) than in normal operation (see picture2).
Thus, a test is performed comparing the knock sensor voltage deviation to a threshold (see picture1)
These two ?rst tests determine the correct operation of the knock sensor. They are done on only one cylinder
per knock sensor.
3-test on the acquisition chain is performed. If the signal formatting is done by a hardware component, the
correct programming of the knock IC is checked. If the formatting is done by software algorithms it is checked
if the transmission of the values from the buffer to the application is done correctly.

ERR_REL is set to 0.

53.14.2.2.2.2 Knock sensor basic diag
The basic diag compares the current value of the knock sensor signal (KNKS) to a minimal admissible level.
If the value is lower than this low threshold, a basic error is detected.
Diag is done in 4 steps:
* Evaluation of diag conditions
* Symptom detection
* Filtering
* Diag result condition
53.14.2.2.2.2.1 Basic diag: activation condition
Basic diag is activated above TCO, MAF_HB and N_32 threshold.
Basic diag is also activated if LV_DIAG_BAS_KNK_EOL ?ag is set, to allow end of line speci?c activation condi-
tions (these conditions must be implemented in diag application-incidence).
Project-speci?c inhibition condition can be added with inhibition ?ag.

53.14.2.2.2.3 Knock sensor relative diag
The relative diagnosis compares the standard deviation (scattering or dispersion of the signal) of the acquired
value of knock sensor signal with a minimal admissible level.
If the dispersion of the acquired value is lower than this minimal threshold a relative error is detected.

53.14.2.2.2.3.2 Relative diag: symptom detection
Relative sensor failure is detected if
KNKS_ERR_REL[NR_KNK_SENS] <IP_KNKS_ERR_REL[NR_KNK_SENS].
To avoid toggles on relative symptom, a ?lter is added: failure must be detected for some consecutive cycles
to be con?rmed.
The CTR_ERR_SYM_REL_KNK counter is loaded with C_CTR_ERR_SYM_REL_KNK when no failure is detected.
If a failure is seen, the counter is decremented each 100 ms, and the symptom is activated when the counter
is at 0.

53.14.2.3 Knock signal acquisition chain diagnosis
Here the integrity of the whole signal acquisition chain of the knock sensor is tested : knock sensor and knock
IC. If an error on this chain is declared, the data LV_ERR_KNK is set.
LV_ERR_KNK is used for limp-home strategy of the knock.
The ?ag LV_ERR_SYM_KNK is used to inhibit adaptive programming gain function on instantaneous failure.

KNCK, Knock sensor diagnosis (Appl. Inc.)
� Import actions:
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(IN <PRM_FID>, OUT <PRM_LV_PRMS>)
� General Information
The short trip is activated if the VAG-Tester-Function-04 Measure-Value-Block 28 or MVB 200 are requested.
VAG_FCT_04_MVB_28 and VAG_FCT_04_MVB_200 are function calls which are requested by the VAG-Tester-
Function-04.
At the request of the short trip the air conditioning system is deactivated and the canister purge valve is
closed.
The short trip can only be carried out once again within the same driving cycle if the failure memory has been
deleted.
This application incidence give the possibility to de?ne customer speci?c conditions for inhibiting the diagnosis
of knock sensors for basic and relative diagnosis. By default the inhibition ?ags are set to 0.
LV_DIAG_BAS_KNK_EOL and LV_DIAG_REL_KNK_EOL are used to activate knock sensor diagnosis for End of
Line test. When these ?ags are active, the corresponding diagnosis is activated, without any condition on
engine working point.
For aggregate test purpose, these ?ags can be activated with a calibration of C_STATE_TEST_DIAG_KNK_APP
or with VAG-Tester Function 04. This condition has to be removed for normal project operation.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: SEG

NC_IDX_ERR_KNK_RTD_LIM
[NC_CYL_NR]
ACTION_KNCK_ResetDiagRtdLim 0...NC_CYL_
NR-1
spark retard caused by knocking on the limitation cylinder[NC_CYL_NR]
� General Information
Service shops must be able to get information about duration of maximum spark retard caused by knocking
e.g. in case of engine damages.
Description:
In case the spark retard from the knock control reaches a maximum limitation a timer is incremented. If a
tuneable threshold is exceeded an ABC counter starts incrementing segment synchronous. After a tuneable
number of segments, a fault is detected by the error management.
The index ?k? indicates the number of exhaust cylinder banks.
Failure reaction: see QVM
Con?guration for diagnostic symptoms:
For each cylinder a separate fault location is used
symptoms for cylinder[NC_CYL_NR]
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At ECU reset, and Key Off to On
for i = 0 to NC_CYL_NR - 1
ACTION_ERRM_Reset(NC_IDX_ERR_KNK_RTD_LIM[i])
ACTION_KNCK_ResetDiagRtdLim(0, i)
end
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
otherwise
reset timer at deactivation

KNCK, Knock control at limitation diagnostics
Recurrence: all segment synchronous (analogous knock control) except
T_KNK_RTD_LIM: recurrence 100 ms
� Function Description
Symptoms calculation :
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_KNK_RTD_LIM, LV_PRMS_TMP )
if LV_KNK_CTL_ENA = 1 and
LV_PRMS_TMP = 1
then
if IGA_ADJ_KNK[SEG_NR] <= IGA_ADJ_MAX_KNK_DIAG
then increment T_KNK_RTD_LIM[SEG_NR]
if T_KNK_RTD_LIM[SEG_NR] >= C_T_KNK_RTD_LIM_MAX
then LF_STATE_DGO_RTD_LIM[SEG_NR] = 3 (SYM + CDN)
else LF_STATE_DGO_RTD_LIM[SEG_NR] = 1 (NO_SYM + CDN)
endif
else LF_STATE_DGO_RTD_LIM[SEG_NR] = 1 (NO_SYM + CDN)
T_KNK_RTD_LIM[SEG_NR] = 0 s (reset timer)
endif
else
LF_STATE_DGO_RTD_LIM[SEG_NR] = 0
endif
Window calculation :
To set the end ?ag for similar conditions LV_END_DIAG_WIN_KNK_RTD_LIM[SEG_NR] the diagnostic conditions
must be ful?lled and the timer T_SUM_END_DIAG_WIN_KNK_RTD_LIM[SEG_NR] has reached the calibration
threshold above the threshold de?ned by C_T_SUM_END_KNK_RTD_LIM or an error is occurred.
Recurrence: 100ms
#IF NLC_ENA_SCDN = 1
#THEN
For x = [0...NC_CYL_NR-1]
if bit nr. 0 of LF_STATE_DGO_RTD_LIM[x] = 1
then
ACTION_ERRM_CdnDiagScdn(NC_IDX_ERR_KNK_RTD_LIM[x])
if T_SUM_END_DIAG_WIN_KNK_RTD_LIM[x]=
C_T_SUM_END_KNK_RTD_LIM
then LV_END_DIAG_WIN_KNK_RTD_LIM[SEG_NR] = 0
T_SUM_END_DIAG_WIN_KNK_RTD_LIM[x] = 0
endif
increment T_SUM_END_DIAG_WIN_KNK_RTD_LIM[x]
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_KNK_WIN_RTD_LIM[x],
LV_PRMS_TMP )
if (T_SUM_END_DIAG_WIN_KNK_RTD_LIM[x]>=
C_T_SUM_END_KNK_RTD_LIM
or LV_PRMS_TMP = 0
then LV_END_DIAG_WIN_KNK_RTD_LIM[SEG_NR] = 1
ACTION_ERRM_EndWinScdn(NC_IDX_ERR_KNK_RTD_LIM[x], 0 )
endif
endif
#ENDIF
ACTION_ERRM_ResultDiag(NC_IDX_ERR_KNK_RTD_LIM [SEG_NR], LF_STATE_DGO_RTD_LIM)

(This function is called after calculation MISF aggr and KNKS

� Function Description
PI_SHUT_OFF[x] failure entry is set when cylinder x is shut off due to pre ignition for a "short" time (e.g.
500ms).
PI[x] failure entry is set when
- engine torque reduction due to pre ignition is higher than a threshold (e.g. 10%)
- cylinder x is shut off due to pre ignition detection for a "long" time
- pre ignition is con?rmed on cylinder x, but no cylinder shut off is allowed by project calibration (lc_ena_pi_off_iv
= 0)

// use of CONTI PI solution

THEN(1)
Increment counter CTR_SEG_PRE_IGN_DET_CUS
LF_STATE_DGO = 1 // CDN bit is set
IF(2) [ LC_ENA_PI_OFF_IV = 1
AND bit[CYL_ID_KNK] of INH_IV_PI = 1
AND LV_REQ_IV_OFF_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
]
OR
[ LC_ENA_PI_OFF_IV = 0
AND ( LV_DET_CFM_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
OR LV_DET_CFM_KNK_PRE_MAIN_PI[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
OR LV_DET_CFM_KNK_PRE_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
OR LV_DET_CFM_KNK_PI_SLOW[CYL_ID_KNK] = 1
)
]
OR FAC_TQI_POW_LIM_PI < C_FAC_TQI_LIM_PI_THD
THEN(2)
LF_STATE_DGO bit.1 = 1 // SYM bit is set
ELSE(2)
IF(3) CTR_SEG_PRE_IGN_DET_CUS >= C_CTR_SEG_PRE_IGN_DET_CUS
THEN(3)

KNCK, Acquisition of knock sensor signal (gen)
53.18 Acquisition of knock sensor signal (gen)
� Calibration interfering functions:
Following functions must be calibrated before knock detection:
? Basic airpath
? Basic VVT setpoints
? Basic VIM setpoints
? Basic spark advance and fuel enrichment mappings
? Knock sensor position is de?ned
� Calibration ?owchart:
? Apply default calibration
? Disable knock detection, knock control, adaptive gain, load dynamic and speed dynamic functions and
knock sensor diagnostic
? Calibration steps :
? Knock measurement windows (pre and main window)
? Filtering frequency
? Noise level setpoint
? Integration time constant
? Input gain
? Engine noise ?ltering
? Gain adaption
? Threshold calculation and Detection energy determination
? Verify calibration: correlation between knock detected events and overpressure, for all engine operating
points.
All steps must be done on engine testbench, using cylinder pressure sensors and acquisition unit. Steps 4
(integration time constant), 5 (input gain), 6 (engine noise ?ltering) and 8 (threshold calculation) can be slightly
reworked on car.

53.18.1.2 Calibration process for pre-window
Note: the window can be calibrated using only the knock sensor, not connected to the ECU.
Pre window is dedicated to pre-ignition detection.
For each breakpoint, ensure that pre-ignition events are located into the pre-window. If not, adjust window
begining (IP_KNKWB_PRE_H_RNG) and duration (IP_KNKWD_PRE).
It must be noted that a minimum deadtime has to be respected between end of pre-window and begining of
main window (typically 0.5 ms).
53.18.1.3 Calibration process for main window
Note: the main window can be calibrated using only the knock sensor, not connected to the ECU.
For each breakpoint, increase ignition angle to be in the knock and display the raw knock sensor signal (before
ECU) vs crank angle.

53.18.2.2 Multifrequency ?lter parameter
The diagram below shows an overview of the knock energy value calculation used for knock detection. There
are three ?lters (NC_NR_MAX_FRQ = 3) followed by an integration unit which results are added together.

Each ?lter unit is a second order bandpass ?lters with tuneable central frequency and tuneable bandwidth
(Q-factor). There is one central frequency for each ?lter (see picture below). An individual weighting factor to
each ?lter branch is applied within the integration unit.

53.18.2.2.2 Calibration process for the pre-window
Important note: for knock by IC aggregate (version 02), it is not possible to use different frequency, gain,
integration time constant for pre and for main window. for knock by IC aggregate (version 02), parameters
for the pre-window are the same as for main window.
For each engine speed and load, record knock sensor signal and cylinder pressure with pre-ignition and with-
out pre-ignition, taking the window into account (do not record signals out of the pre-window).
Calculate and draw FFT for each record.
Choose frequency to have:
? The best signal to noise
? The best relationship between signal amplitude and pre-ignition amplitude.
Calibrate ID_KNKS_FIL_FRQ_PRE with the decimal value corresponding to the chosen frequency (see conver-
sion table in appendix).
53.18.2.2.3 Calibration process for the main window
Notes: the window can be calibrated using only the knock sensor, not connected to the ECU.
For each engine speed and load, record knock sensor signal and cylinder pressure with knock and without
knock, taking the window into account (do not record signals out of the knock measurement window).
Calculate and draw FFT for each record.
Choose frequency to have:
? The best signal to noise ratio (high energy when knocking, low energy when not knocking)
? The best relationship between signal amplitude and overpressure.
Calibrate ID_KNKS_FIL_FRQ with the decimal value corresponding to the chosen frequency (see conversion
table in appendix). In this example, frequency is 7.5 kHz and ID_KNKS_FIL_FRQ value is 43.

53.18.2.3.3 Calibration process for the main window
Objective is to adjust ITC with gain ?xed to nominal value (31) in order to keep noise level close to the noise
level setpoint.
Advices: usually the ITC should be very small for low engine speed (lower than 5) and stay lower than 15 for
highest engine speed. A higher value could mean that the window is too large or the hardware gain is not
adapted to the basic engine noise level.

53.18.2.4.2 Calibration process for the pre-window
Important note: for knock by IC aggregate (version 02), it is not possible to use different frequency, gain,
integration time constant for pre and for main window. for knock by IC aggregate (version 02), parameters
for the pre-window are the same as for main window.
For each breakpoint, adjust IP_KNKS_GAIN_PRE to move the knock signal (KNKS_PRE) as close as possible to
the noise level setpoint.
53.18.2.4.3 Calibration process for the main window
First, engine breakpoints have to be calibrated. In order to consider engine noise dispersion following engine
speed, engine speed breakpoints for gain mappings will be optimized.
Run a full load every 200rpm. Engine speed breakpoints have to be set at each in?ection point of engine noise
signal.
MAF break points have to be set equidistant between the lowest load and the highest load for the engine.
Once breakpoints are chosen, input gain can be calibrated.
For each breakpoint, adjust IP_KNKS_GAIN to move the knock signal (KNKS) as close as possible to the noise
level setpoint.
At this step, gain values should normally be included between 20 & 40 in order to give enough authority to
the adaptive correction.
53.18.2.5 Note for knock by soft (KNCK aggregate version 03)
Calibration for knock by soft is exactly the same as for knock by IC (aggregate version 02), except the following
points:
1. knock window should end before 60 �CRK (IP_KNKWB + IP_KNKWD <60 �CRK)

3. During knock window calibration, the ?ag LV_KNK_ACQ_ERR has to be checked. If this ?ag is set, this
means that knock window is too long, and the acquisition buffer for 1 cylinder has been overwritten by
the next cylinder. In this case, knock window has to be reduced, or the acquisition con?guration has to
be changed to use 2 acquisition buffer for each cylinder (IO driver con?guration, SW rebuild is needed).
53.18.3 Engine noise ?ltering
The main issue for the knock detection is the dynamic comparison between engine noise with and without
knock.
When engine is not knocking, the engine noise is calculated by ?ltering the knock signal KNKS with a low-pass
?lter.
When the engine natural noise is increasing (not because of a knock event), the ?ltering must be strongest
to avoid the average noise following too rapidly the instantaneous noise (this would induce a reduction of
detection sensitivity).
On the other hand, when the noise decreases, the ?ltering is lighter so that the average noise goes back rapidly
to the instantaneous noise and a good sensitivity is maintained.
In case of transient condition (load or speed dynamic detection), the normal engine noise is increasing very
fast. Due to the dif?culties for a robust knock control in transient, the ?lter is usually bypassed by setting the
?ltering coef?cient to 1. This way, knock detection is frozen.
When engine is knocking, knock signal can reach high values and completely saturate the average noise (NL).
To avoid this, ?lter is not used anymore, and noise is computed by adding a ?xed increment to the former
noise value.
And at least, when a failure is detected on a knock sensor, the noise calculation must be frozen at a ?xed
value.
To sum-up,
1. NL when no knock detection (since C_CYCNR_KNK_DET)
2. Steady condition (no load dynamic nor speed dynamic detection)
If KNKS >NL + C_NL_OFS (e.g. if KNKS is increasing)
NLn = NLn?1 + C_NL_FIL_GAIN_INC x ( KNKSn - NLn?1)
Else
NLn = NLn?1 + C_NL_FIL_GAIN x ( KNKSn - NLn?1)
? Transient condition (LV_N_TRA_KNK = 1 or LV_MAF_TRA_KNK=1)
NLn = NLn?1 + C_NL_FIL_GAIN_TRA x ( KNKSn - NLn?1)
Usually, C_NL_FIL_GAIN_TRA is set to 1 (no ?ltering)
1. NL when knock detection: NL n = NLn?1 + C_NL_INC
2. NL in Limp home mode: NL = C_NL_LIH

53.18.5 Threshold calculation
The knock detection is done by comparison of the instantaneous noise signal KNK and the average noise NL
multiplied by a gain plus an offset.
Gain and offset represent the detection line
Knock energy is computed as follow:
( ) KNK TRA FAC CADD THD KNKS IP FAC THD KNKS IP NL 
KNKS EGY KNKS __________ ?+?=
In case of transient condition (load or speed dynamic detection), an additional gain C_FAC_TRA_KNK is applied
to the threshold. This way, knock detection can be frozen by setting the threshold to max value, and the energy
to low value.

53.18.5.2 Calibration process
 
offset 1/Gain 
Physically, a knock event must be detected when the cylinder over-pressure is exceeding a threshold (given
as input by the engine designers).
Objective of the threshold calibration is to set a ?ag for ?logical? knock event (LV_KNK = 1) each time a physical
knock event is present.
Statistically, the calibration should guaranty that at least 90% of the physical knock events are detected.
Note: For this calibration, knock detection must be enabled (LV_KNK_DET_ENA = 1).
Display cylinder pressure and LV_KNK.
For each engine speed and load breakpoint, adjust gain (IP_KNKS_THD_FAC) of the detection line to reach the
same detection level with cylinder over-pressures and LV_KNK.
On a ?rst step, offset (IP_KNKS_THD_ADD) must be kept at 0.
On a second step, when reworking calibration on car, gain (IP_KNKS_THD_FAC) of the detection line must not
be changed. The offset (IP_KNKS_THD_ADD) can be adjusted in case of detection issues.
53.18.6 Detection energy determination
A knock event (LV_KNK = 1) is generated if the knock energy is more than C_KNKS_EGY_THD.
Note: this is evaluated only if knock detection is enabled (LV_KNK_DET_ENA = 1).

KNCK, Knock control (gen)
53.19 Knock control (gen)
� General Information:
Calibration interfering functions:
Following functions must be calibrated before knock control:
Knock detection
Calibration ?owchart:
Apply default calibration
Calibration steps :
? Knock activation conditions
? Instantaneous and fast loop
? Adaptation circuit 1
? Global adaptation circuit
? Knock control passive, ?nal correction applied, sum of adaptation circuit
? Knock control limitations
? Knock prevention in instationnary conditions
Verify calibration
53.19.1 Knock activation conditions
For consistent operation, activation conditions must be calibrated to guarantee that in typical driving cycle
the following activation order is respected:
1. Knock sensor diagnostic
2. Knock detection and control
3. Adaptation 1 loop
4. Global adaptation loop
The engine operating point for input gain adaptation activation must be higher than for knock sensor
diag.
Knock detection and knock control enable
Knock detection and knock control are enabled if:
1. MAF is higher than the threshold de?ned by IP_MAF_HB_MIN_KNK (depending on N and TCO) to avoid
misdetection at low load due to high mechanical noise
2. Ignition key is ON
3. Engine is running in homogeneous mode
If knock limp home is activated (by knock sensor failure or engine synchronisation failure), knock detection
and control is deactivated for the cylinders in limp home only.
Knock control and detection should not be activated during engine start . Minimum engine speed for
knock detection is idle speed.

Use typical RON fuel.
Input gain adaptation enable
Input gain adaptation is intended to compensate long-term deviations on knock sensor resulting on knock
signal average value changing.
Input gain adaptation is enabled if:
? knock detection is enabled,
? Engine is not in transient phase (see load and speed dynamic detection)
? Engine speed is between C_N_MIN_KNK_AD and C_N_MAX_KNK_AD thresholds
? Engine load is higher than C_MAF_MIN_KNK_AD,
? TCO is higher than C_TCO_KNK_AD,
? C_CTR_NL_AD_KNK TDC are elapsed since the last detected knock event,
? There is no knock sensor failure symptom
Default calibration
Name Default value
C_N_MAX_KNK_AD 4500 rpm
Condition on maximum engine speed to enable the calculation of adaptation
C_N_MIN_KNK_AD 1500 rpm
Condition on minimum engine speed to enable the calculation of adaptation
C_MAF_MIN_KNK_AD 300 mg/stk
Condition on load to authorise the calculation of adaptation
C_TCO_KNK_AD 65 �C
Condition on TCO to authorise the calculation of adaptation
C_CTR_NL_AD_KNK 16 TDC
Number of tdc since the last knock detection before enabling the calculation of adaptation
Calibration process
Thresholds have to be chosen in operating range where the engine noise (without knock) is stable and
smooth.
This operating range should also be calibrated in such a way that the input gain adaptation is activated
during a typical driving cycle.
The engine operating point for input gain adaptation activation must be higher than for knock sensor
diag.
Adaptation loop 1 (AD1) enable
Adaptation loop 1 is activated if:
? Knock control is activated,
? Engine is not in transient phase (see load and speed dynamic detection)

In high engine load (high maf), knock can damage the engine in short time.
The adaptation 1 loop must be active in this critical area.
Default de?nition for critical area is the engine load where the knock margin (e.g. the difference between

Typical RON fuel must be used for this calibration.

KNCK, Knock control (gen)
Load dynamic detection
Due to averaging process and SW treatment delay times, there is always a delay time from knock event to
change in knock signal, and then to noise value change.
In case of very fast engine load change, this can lead to false detection because the knock signal is rising
too fast for using normal NL ?ltering.
To avoid this, a speci?c ?lter for NL calculation is used in case of fast load change, and the knock detection
threshold is increased by a speci?c multiplicative factor.
In the same time, AD 1 loop is deactivated (the memorized corrections are applied) and input gain adapta-
tion is frozen.
Default calibration
Name Default value
ID_CYCNR_FAC_TRA_KNK 30 tdc
LDPM_N_32_5_KNCK Idle speed / 1300 rpm / 2000 rpm / 4000 rpm
Cycle counter during which the Load Dynamic Function stays active after triggering
ID_MAF_DIF_TRA_KNK 10 mg/stk
LDPM_N_32_5_KNCK Idle speed / 1300 rpm / 2000 rpm / 4000 rpm
MAF difference for Load Dynamic Recognition
Notes:
? size of LDPM_N_32_5_KNCK can be adjusted in KNCK con?guration data speci?cation. Default size is 4
breakpoints
Calibration process
Under the condition of knock-free operation, different load ramps with different gradients are to be checked
for various operating points.
If knock events are detected during a ramp, ID_N_GRD_MAX_KNK has to be calibrated with the ramp
speed.
Speed dynamic detection
Due to averaging process and SW treatment delay times, there is always a delay time from knock event to
change in knock signal, and then to noise value change.
In case of very fast engine speed change, this can lead to false detection because the knock signal is rising
too fast for using normal NL ?ltering.
To avoid this, a speci?c ?lter for NL calculation is used in case of fast speed change, and the knock detection
threshold is increased by a speci?c multiplicative factor.
In the same time, AD 1 loop is deactivated (the memorized corrections are applied) and input gain adapta-
tion is frozen.

ID_N_GRD_MAX_KNK 100 rpm/s

First, the engine working point (IDX_IGA_AD_1_KNK_SAVE) is calculated, and compared to the previous

Then once IGA_AD_1_KNK has reached the saved value, AD 1 loop is operating in adaptation mode

Global adaptation circuit
Because of a bad fuel, the AD 1 corrections are larger than usual.
When the mean AD 1 correction is larger than a threshold, an adaptive factor FAC_AD_KNK is incremented,
and a correction IGA_AD_KNK is calculated and applied to all cylinders.
If the mean AD 1 correction is becoming smaller than a second threshold, the global adaptive factor is
decremented and the ignition angle correction is progressively cancelled.
A global adaptive factor at 0 means the fuel quality is good, at 1 means the fuel quality is very bad.
As it can appends that in some working points the engine is not knocking, the global AD factor must be
kept unchanged for these WP to avoid ramping down to 0. This is done by comparing the IP_IGA_BAS_
DIF_AD_KNK calibration to a threshold C_IGA_BAS_DIF_AD_KNK_ENA. If the calibration is higher than the
threshold, then the global adaptive factor is frozen.
A special limitation during a driving cycle is possible. If the adaptation conditions are active for a certain
time after an engine start, the FAC_AD_KNK is considered as correct (e.g. representative of the fuel quality).
After this time, FAC_AD_KNK change is allowed only as a percentage of the ?correct? value.
During the power latch phase, the adaptive factor is stored in the non volatile memory and read back at
the next key on.
Before storing the value, the global AD factor can be modi?ed depending on TCO, or can be reset to 0 if
LC_KNK_AD_CLR is active
A special bench mode activated by LC_FAC_AD_KNK_MAN_ACT allows manual setting of FAC_AD_KNK

53.19.3 Knock prevention in instationary conditions
As is it dif?cult to do a robust closed-loop knock control during transient conditions, knock detection and
control are disabled when a load or a speed dynamic is detected.
At the same time, audible knock can appear during transient conditions. Even if this knock is not really
dangerous for the engine, a opened-loop correction have to be done to anticipate this audible knock.
This correction is done through the knock prevention in instationnary conditions function.
In case of throttle position gradient or intake manifold pressure gradient exceeding adjustable limits (e.g. in
transient condition), an ignition angle intervention shall be performed to avoid knocking combustion.
When a transient on TPS or MAP is detected, the DELAY state is entered. In this state, no intervention
is done on ignition angle (except if LC_SCH_TRA_KNK is set). During this delay, the ignition intervention
is calculated (depending on engine operating point, temperature, gearbox ratio, vehicle speed) and the
strongest intervention is selected. The delay state is ?nished when a calibratable number of segments has
passed, and the ACTIVE state is entered.
In the ACTIVE state, the ignition intervention calculated before is applied, during a calibratable number of
segments. When this time is passed, the RAMP state is entered.
During the RAMP state, the ignition intervention is slowly reset to 0 with a calibratable increment.
Once the ignition intervention is reset to 0, the WAIT state is activated. During this state, no detection of
transient is performed, to avoid several consecutive detections caused by the same transient. This wait
time is calibratable.
At any time, the ignition intervention is reset to 0 if engine speed drops below a threshold (C_N_MIN_IGA_
TRA_CS) or if the drive train is not engaged.

Calibration process
Transient detection:
With standard air and coolant temperature conditions, do standard, medium and strong take-off from idle
speed .
Repeat the same test starting from higher speeds: around 1800 rpm, and then 3000 rpm.
Calibrate ID_TPS_GRD_IGA_TRA_KNK & ID_MAP_DRV1_IGA_TRA_KNK with the values of TPS_GRD and MAP_
DRV0.
Delay:
Usually, a gradient if detected ?rst on TPS, then on MAP. The MAF is then following, and an overshoot can
be seen on the MAF signal.
The delay ID_STATE_DLY_CYC_IGA_TRA_KNK must be adjusted to start the ignition intervention on the
maximum value of the MAF overshoot .
53.19.4 Calibration validation
Knock statistics
The purpose of knock statistics is to correlate the anti-knock activity of the ECU with the real measured
knock events (through in cylinder pressure sensor). This can be used to prove the correct behaviour of the
knock control.
This validation test is conducted at engine dyno testbench, with a typical engine (for compression ratio),
nominal knock sensor. The engine must be ?tted with in-cylinder pressure sensor.
For each engine operating points, 10 000 cycles are recorded, and a statistic tool is used to count the
number of cycles where over-pressure is present in each cylinder, and the number of cycles where the
knock correction is active.
Typically, engine speeds breakpoints are 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000, 5000 and 6000 rpm. Engine load
breakpoints are full load, 80% and 60% of full load.
This validation should be done with typical and low RON fuel, typical and high intake air temperature.

53.20.1.1 Function information
Two diagnosis are performed on each knock sensor:
Basic diagnostic, by comparing the signal to a threshold
Relative diagnostic, by comparing the standard deviation of the signal to a threshold.
An other diagnosis is existing: SPI bus shut off. This indicates a wrong communication between the processor
and the circuit used to interface the knock sensor.
Due to the hardware input stage, short-circuit to battery, to ground, or open circuit have the same conse-
quence: after treatment (?ltering, integration, ...) KNKS signal becomes low compared to the standard noise
signal. This level is monitored to generate the basic diagnostic.
An other indication of a sensor failure is the standard deviation of the electrical noise, which is lower in case of
failure. This is used to generate the relative diagnostic.
In order to guaranty good knock sensor failure detection, recommendations for knock sensor mounting and
wiring must be followed.
These recommendation are reminded here:
? Respect sensor mounting recommendations (operating temperature, mounting screw, mounting torque,
surface state of the engine bloc, ...)
? Shielded wire must be used. If not possible, a twisted pair could be used, but need to be veri?ed with
engine. Standard wires (not shielded nor twisted) must not be used.
? Avoid as much as possible to integrate the knock sensors wires inside the engine electrical common
harness. If possible insure that the routing of the knock sensors wires is totally independent of this
common harness. If not possible, no more than 20cm of the knock sensors wires can be feed into
common harness.
? Insure a good separation (at least at 10cm) between each knock sensor wire and any kind of high
impedance and/or high power electrical signal (ignition coil wire).
? A waterproof connector must be used.
? The total length of the knock sensors wires must not exceed 1,5m inside the engine housing,
